decision_conditions: The replacement tree must be planted by April 2024; of either Yew (Taxus baccata) or Scots Pine (Pinus sylvestris) that is more suited to the site and of a size not less than 10-12cm girth when planted. | Failure to do so will result in a tree replacement notice under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | It is recommended that planting takes place between the months of October and March but being careful to avoid periods of waterlogging or hard frost. | If the new tree's species is different from that removed, then Ealing's Planning department must be consulted before planting is completed.
description:
T1 Monterey cypress, Cupressus macrocarpa-Crown reduction; reduce height by approximately 3m; pruning of lateral branches to balance

T2 Purple plum -  Reduce height by 2m

TPO 322 T3 Coastal redwood-removal of the tree
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
